neighborhoods.name: Centre Historique
neighborhoods.character: The medieval heart of Avignon, dominated by the imposing Palais des Papes and surrounded by well-preserved 14th-century ramparts.

location.description: Located within the medieval city walls, centered around the Palais des Papes and Place du Palais.

history.overview: The original medieval core of Avignon, developed around the papal palace when it served as the center of Christianity in the 14th century.
history.significance: UNESCO World Heritage site and former papal capital, home to the largest Gothic palace in Europe.

transit: Walking distance to all major sites
Taxi stands at Place du Palais
practical_info.safety: Very safe with regular police presence and constant foot traffic.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for palace tours, evening for atmospheric dining and walks.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with pedestrian areas and short distances.

attractions.name: Palais des Papes
attractions.description: The largest Gothic palace in Europe, UNESCO World Heritage site and former papal residence.
attractions.appeal: Essential visit for understanding Avignon's papal history and medieval grandeur.

attractions.name: Place du Palais
attractions.description: Grand square in front of the papal palace with spectacular views and historic atmosphere.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for photography and understanding the scale of the palace.

attractions.name: Cathédrale Notre-Dame des Doms
attractions.description: Romanesque cathedral with golden Virgin Mary statue and papal tombs.
attractions.appeal: Beautiful architecture and panoramic views from the terrace.

dining.name: Christian Etienne
dining.known_for: Seasonal truffle menus and Provençal specialties

activities.name: Palace Audio Tour
activities.description: Explore the papal palace with multimedia guides and historical context.

activities.name: Medieval Ramparts Walk
activities.description: Walk along the well-preserved medieval city walls for unique perspectives.

stay_here_if: You want to be at the heart of Avignon's history and culture
You prefer walking to most attractions and restaurants
insider_tips: Visit the palace early morning to avoid crowds.
Evening walks along the ramparts offer magical atmosphere.

neighborhoods.name: Place de l'Horloge
neighborhoods.character: The vibrant heart of Avignon's social life, surrounded by historic buildings, cafés, restaurants, and the famous 19th-century clock tower.

location.description: Located in the heart of the old town, connecting the palace area with the shopping districts.

history.overview: Traditional meeting place and commercial center of Avignon, developed around the town hall and clock tower.
history.significance: Social and cultural hub of the city, where locals and visitors gather for coffee and people-watching.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant activity and good lighting.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for coffee culture, evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent for walking with pedestrian areas and flat terrain.

attractions.name: Clock Tower
attractions.description: Beautiful 19th-century clock tower with ornate decoration and chimes.
attractions.appeal: Iconic symbol of Avignon and perfect photo opportunity.

attractions.name: Hôtel de Ville
attractions.description: Historic town hall building with beautiful architecture and public access areas.
attractions.appeal: Experience local government and admire historic architecture.

attractions.name: Historic Cafés
attractions.description: Traditional Provençal cafés with outdoor terraces and local atmosphere.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for experiencing local café culture and people-watching.

dining.name: Le Grand Café
dining.known_for: Historic café with terrace on the square

activities.name: Café Culture Experience
activities.description: Spend time in traditional cafés observing local life and social interactions.

activities.name: Square Photography
activities.description: Capture the vibrant atmosphere and historic architecture of the square.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of Avignon's social life
You enjoy café culture and people-watching
avoid_if: You want to avoid tourist crowds
insider_tips: Morning coffee here offers the best people-watching opportunities.
Evening dining reservations are recommended during peak season.

neighborhoods.name: Rue des Teinturiers
neighborhoods.character: A charming historic street along the Sorgue River, once home to Avignon's textile dyers, now featuring art galleries, boutiques, and atmospheric cafés.

location.description: Located along the Sorgue River, running parallel to the main shopping streets in the old town.

history.overview: Historic street where Avignon's textile dyers worked, using the Sorgue River for their craft.
history.significance: Preserved example of medieval industrial architecture and traditional Provençal street life.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with good lighting and regular foot traffic.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Afternoon for gallery browsing, evening for atmospheric dining.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent for walking with flat terrain and scenic river views.

attractions.name: Historic Water Wheels
attractions.description: Well-preserved medieval water wheels that powered the textile industry.
attractions.appeal: Unique industrial heritage and excellent photography subjects.

attractions.name: Art Galleries
attractions.description: Collection of independent art galleries showcasing local and regional artists.
attractions.appeal: Discover local artistic talent and unique artworks.

attractions.name: Sorgue River Path
attractions.description: Peaceful walking path along the river with beautiful views and vegetation.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for peaceful walks and nature appreciation.

activities.name: Gallery Hopping
activities.description: Visit multiple art galleries and discover local artistic talent.

activities.name: Riverside Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful walks along the Sorgue River with beautiful views.

stay_here_if: You appreciate artistic atmosphere and riverside charm
You want to be close to galleries and boutiques
avoid_if: You prefer bustling city center atmosphere
You want extensive shopping and nightlife options
insider_tips: Visit galleries in the afternoon when they're most welcoming.
Riverside dining is magical in the evening.

neighborhoods.name: Rocher des Doms
neighborhoods.character: A beautiful public garden perched on a rocky outcrop above the city, offering spectacular panoramic views of Avignon, the Rhône River, and the surrounding countryside.

location.description: Located above the historic center, accessible from the cathedral area and offering elevated views.

history.overview: Natural rocky outcrop that has served as a strategic viewpoint and peaceful retreat throughout Avignon's history.
history.significance: Historic viewpoint and green space that provides perspective on the city's layout and development.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with good lighting and regular visitors.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Sunset for best views, morning for peaceful walks.
practical_info.walkability: Good for walking with paved paths and gentle slopes.

attractions.name: Panoramic Viewpoints
attractions.description: Multiple viewpoints offering 360-degree views of Avignon and the Rhône Valley.
attractions.appeal: Best views of the city and surrounding Provençal landscape.

attractions.name: Public Gardens
attractions.description: Beautiful Mediterranean gardens with native plants, walking paths, and shaded areas.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for peaceful walks and nature appreciation.

attractions.name: Sunset Spot
attractions.description: Famous location for watching spectacular sunsets over the Rhône River.
attractions.appeal: Magical evening atmosphere and photography opportunities.

activities.name: Sunset Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning sunset views over Avignon and the Rhône River.

activities.name: Garden Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful walks through Mediterranean gardens with city views.

stay_here_if: You want peaceful atmosphere with spectacular views
You enjoy nature and garden walks
avoid_if: You prefer bustling city center atmosphere
You want easy access to shopping and nightlife
insider_tips: Best sunset photos are taken 30 minutes before official sunset.
Morning visits offer peaceful atmosphere and clear views.

neighborhoods.name: Les Halles
neighborhoods.character: The vibrant covered market area where locals and visitors gather to experience the best of Provençal gastronomy, fresh produce, and local specialties.

location.description: Located at Place Pie, the main market square in the heart of the old town.

history.overview: Traditional market area that has served as Avignon's culinary heart for centuries.
history.significance: Center of Provençal food culture and local social life, where traditional market traditions continue.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant activity and local presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for best selection, lunch for market dining.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent for walking with pedestrian areas and market access.

attractions.name: Les Halles d'Avignon
attractions.description: Famous covered market featuring the best of Provençal gastronomy and local specialties.
attractions.appeal: Essential experience for understanding local food culture and traditions.

attractions.name: Market Stalls
attractions.description: Individual stalls offering fresh produce, cheeses, charcuterie, and regional specialties.
attractions.appeal: Direct access to local producers and authentic products.

attractions.name: Food Culture
attractions.description: Immersion in Provençal food culture and local social interactions.
attractions.appeal: Authentic local experience and culinary education.

dining.name: Market Food Stalls
dining.known_for: Fresh local produce and traditional snacks

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Shop for fresh produce and local specialties alongside locals.

activities.name: Food Tasting
activities.description: Sample local products and learn about Provençal specialties.

stay_here_if: You want to be close to local food culture
You enjoy market atmosphere and local commerce
avoid_if: You want to avoid market crowds
insider_tips: Visit early morning for best selection and local atmosphere.
Many vendors offer free samples of their products.
